result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey John Russell was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.

CO: RMW , REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared from jail, pro se. Case called at 1:37 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a probation review hearing. DE states he was given a probation sanction. Is requesting a one day furlough to check into disability benefits. Also addressing a request from the DOC to reduce financial obligations to a civil judgment. DE is not working. Receives disability only. Court will grant DOC's request and enter civil judgment. Regarding the request for furlough, Court can not address since it's a sanction issued by probation.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF374, 14CF466 and 15CF174:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Jeffrey John Russell appeared. Case called at 9:52 a.m. ADA McKinley states there is a joint recommendation. Recites agreement. Atty Schwab in agreement. Will waive any preliminary hearing not held in any of the files. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1  OWI 5th in 14CF374. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 5th in 14CF374. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct. 2 in 14CF374. Court dismisses and reads in 14CF466 and 15CF174. Sentencing arguments. Defendant gives statement. Crt orders:

I/S a bifercated sentence of 6 years total confinement
      - 3 years initial confinement, 3 years ES

- S/W 3 years probation

Conditions of probation:
- 1 year county jail. If becomes employed, court will grant Huber. 32 days jail credit subject to objection from the DA's Office. State has 10 days to file an objection on jail credit.

- If the stay is lifted, defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

- Fine in the amount of $1,284.00. Bond on file to apply to fine. To be paid over the course of probation

- DNA Sample and Surcharge

- Blood draw fee in the amount of $85.50 to be paid to New Richmond Police Department

- Drivers license revoked for a period of 24 months

- IID for a period of 24 months

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-15-2015 09:30 am
